oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Presentation of Joe Parrish cartoon to President Franklin D. Roosevelt, Nashville, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sepia-tone photograph of President Franklin D. Roosevelt and Eleanor Roosevelt seated in the back seat of an open-air automobile. A large crowd surrounds them. Insert cartoon touts FDR and the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA).

Joseph L. Parrish retired as chief editorial cartoonist for the Chicago Tribune in 1970. A native of Tennessee, he began his career at the [Nashville] Tennessean in 1929 and was nationally known for his political caricatures. He moved to the Tribune seven; years later. The Roosevelts visited the James K. Polk tomb, The Hermitage, Fisk and Vanderbilt Universities, and a Madison school during their stop. They also appeared in Knoxville and inspected Norris Dam.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Presidents; Crowds
